title:
Circular Dichroism in Multiphoton Ionization of Resonantly Excited
  Helium Ions near Channel Closing
authors:
Rene Wagner, Markus Ilchen, Nicolas Douguet, Philipp Schmidt, Niclas
  Wieland, Carlo Callegari, Zachary Delk, Alexander Demidovich, Michele Di
  Fraia, Jiri Hofbrucker, Michele Manfredda, Valerija Music, Oksana Plekan,
  Kevin C. Prince, Daniel E. Rivas, Marco Zangrando, Alexei N. Grum-Grzhimailo,
  Klaus Bartschat, and Michael Meyer
abstract:
The circular dichroism (CD) of photoelectrons generated by near-infrared
(NIR) laser pulses using multiphoton ionization of excited He$^+$ ions in the
3p(m=+1) state. The ions were prepared by circularly polarized extreme
ultraviolet (XUV) pulses. For circularly polarized NIR pulses co- and
counter-rotating relative to the polarization of the XUV pulse, a complex
variation of the CD is observed as a result of intensity- and
polarization-dependent Freeman resonances, with and without additional dichroic
AC-Stark shifts. The experimental results are compared with numerical solutions
of the time-dependent Schr\"odinger equation to identify and interpret the
pronounced variation of the experimentally observed CD.
